unverifiedMitreAttackTechniques.reason: Deleting a user account immediately revokes all permissions and access rights associated with that IAM user, disrupting access to critical resources. This action can prevent legitimate users from performing essential tasks, effectively halting operations and response efforts.

The deletion of an IAM user can be part of a deliberate attempt to destroy data or disrupt normal operations. Users often have associated data, policies, and access controls that, when removed, can result in data loss or corruption.

securityImplications: Attackers might use DeleteUser to remove users and their permissions, disrupting access control in AWS. Also, it can be used to delete previously used users to avoid detection.
